Notes.Text:
This update for cni-plugins fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-20206: Fixed arbitrary path injection via type field in CNI configuration (bsc#1181961).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Public Cloud 15

Vulnerabilities.Description: A vulnerability was found in all versions of containernetworking/plugins before version 0.8.6, that allows malicious containers in Kubernetes clusters to perform man-in-the-middle (MitM) attacks. A malicious container can exploit this flaw by sending rogue IPv6 router advertisements to the host or other containers, to redirect traffic to the malicious container.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Public Cloud 15:cni-plugins-0.8.6-150000.1.7.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: An improper limitation of path name flaw was found in containernetworking/cni in versions before 0.8.1. When specifying the plugin to load in the 'type' field in the network configuration, it is possible to use special elements such as "../" separators to reference binaries elsewhere on the system. This flaw allows an attacker to execute other existing binaries other than the cni plugins/types, such as 'reboot'. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Public Cloud 15:cni-plugins-0.8.6-150000.1.7.1
